conflictDescription: User Story A requires the caregiver to decide and control when to share client data, allowing sharing in some cases, while User Story B demands blocking all data sharing with everyone without exception. These goals cannot both be true at the same time.
conflictingNfrPairs: The informal caregiver can choose when to share each client's data
Block all personal data sharing with doctors

Block all personal data sharing with family

Ensure no data is shared with any other parties
The system must protect client privacy by honoring the caregiver's sharing decisions

The system must protect client privacy by honoring the caregiver's sharing decisions
Ensure no data is shared with any other parties
The caregiver maintains control over data sharing actions for each client

The caregiver maintains control over data sharing actions for each client
Block all personal data sharing with family
The caregiver maintains control over data sharing actions for each client
Ensure no data is shared with any other parties
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to decide myself when to share each client's data to protect their privacy and keep control.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to block all data sharing with everyone, including doctors and family, to keep my privacy fully safe.
resolutionDescription: Adjust both stories so caregivers can request data sharing with user consent, while older adults have final control over sharing with doctors and family, balancing privacy and workflow.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to request data sharing with user consent, so that privacy is respected and care is coordinated.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Allow caregivers to request data sharing per client
Require user consent before sharing data
Protect user privacy by enforcing consent decisions
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control data sharing decisions with doctors and family, so my privacy and care needs are protected.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Enable older adults to approve or deny data sharing requests
Allow older adults to set preferences for sharing with doctors
Allow older adults to set preferences for sharing with family

conflictDescription: User Story A requires communication with clients after they give consent, implying some data sharing is allowed with agreement. User Story B demands blocking all data sharing with everyone, including doctors and family, with no exceptions. These two goals cannot be fulfilled at the same time.
conflictingNfrPairs: Only communicate with clients after they give consent
Block all personal data sharing with doctors

Avoid contacting clients without their agreement
Ensure no data is shared with any other parties
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to communicate with clients only when they agree, so I respect their privacy and comfort.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to block all data sharing with everyone, including doctors and family, to keep my privacy fully safe.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to allow data sharing with doctors and family only after explicit consent, balancing privacy with care needs.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to communicate with clients only after they give clear consent, so I respect their privacy.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Communicate with clients only after explicit consent
Respect clients' privacy in all communications
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control data sharing with doctors and family, allowing it only with my clear consent.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Allow data sharing with doctors only after user consent
Allow data sharing with family only after user consent
Block data sharing with others without consent

conflictDescription: The caregiver wants to allow controlled data use on shared devices to protect privacy and avoid mix-ups, but the older adult wants to block all data sharing with everyone, including doctors and family. These goals conflict because full blocking contradicts controlled sharing rules.
conflictingNfrPairs: Allow informal caregiver to set data use rules on shared devices
Block all personal data sharing with doctors
Allow informal caregiver to set data use rules on shared devices
Block all personal data sharing with family
Allow informal caregiver to set data use rules on shared devices
Ensure no data is shared with any other parties
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control ALFRED’s data use on shared devices at home, so I can protect my clients’ privacy and avoid mix-ups.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to block all data sharing with everyone, including doctors and family, to keep my privacy fully safe.
resolutionDescription: The caregiver's need to set data rules is limited by the older adult's consent requirements; both stories are updated to reflect controlled sharing with explicit consent and clear prompts on shared devices.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to set data use rules on shared devices with user consent prompts, so I can protect privacy and avoid confusion.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Allow setting data use rules with explicit user consent
Provide clear prompts when sharing data on shared devices
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control data sharing with doctors and family via clear consent, ensuring privacy on shared devices.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Require clear user consent before sharing data with others
Ensure privacy controls work on shared devices
